page.title: 14General farming in the area
page.content: In this area land use is split primarily two ways. Two thirds are used for wheat and one third is used for dairy cattle. Minor interests appear to be winter grazing for sheep, apple production for the local Taunton Cider Company and eggs from battery hens. The largest farm complex in the area is owned by the Venn family. His recent purchase of Longaller farm (200 acres) is used entirely for wheat and winter barley. It also supports a small cider apple orchard - the rest, including a row of cottages and an old mill is being neglected, and the farm house is being rented out. Of the remaining 500 acres, 300 acres are used for wheat, the rest is pasture for his 200 Friesian and 100 Jersey cattle. During the winter he takes on 1000 sheep.
